page.title: 05A DAY IN MY LIFE:EMMA BROWN.
page.content: 6.00 a.m.! I reach out for the cord next to my bed to turn the light on.I read a book till 6.30 when I get up. I climb sleepily out of bed and draw my curtains, get dressed in my riding clothes, go downstairs and get the keys out of the kitchen cupboard. Then I go out to the stable and get Elly's headcollar and rope, go to the paddock and get Elly, who is my pony. I groom her and tack her up and then take her for a half-hour ride up one of the bridle paths. When I get back I untack Elly and turn her out in the paddock and feed her. I lock my tack in the garage and run back into the pub where I live. I have my breakfast - normally fried bread and sausages - and get ready for school. "HELP MUM!, have you seen my other plimsoll or my reading record or, for that matter, my school- bag and coat?"
